articles.title: Pound faces 'existential crisis', Bank of America warns – live updates - The Telegraph
articles.description: The pound is facing an “existential crisis” and is likely to weaken further during this year, one of Wall Street’s top banks has warned.
articles.content:
Good morning. Brent crude oil has topped $120 per barrel for the first time since March as China prepares to reopen the manufacturing hub city of Shanghai.

articles.title: American comedian's racist remarks spark walkout at Winnipeg comedy show - CBC.ca
articles.description: A Ojibway woman says she was among at least 30 people who walked out of Rumor's Comedy Club in Winnipeg on Friday due to several racist and homophobic comments they heard from the stage.
articles.content:
An Ojibway woman says she was among at least 30 people who walked out of Rumor's Comedy Club in Winnipeg on Friday due to a number of racist and homophobic comments they heard from the stage.

articles.title: Spectacular New Tau Herculids Meteor Shower May Light Up the Skies Over North America - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Astronomers are excited about the possibility of a new meteor shower on May 30-31, the tau Herculid shower, forecast to peak on the night of May 30 and early morning of May 31. Back in 1930, German observers Arnold Schwassmann and Arno Arthur Wachmann discove…
articles.content: This infrared image from NASAs Spitzer Space Telescope shows the broken Comet 73P/Schwassman-Wachmann 3 skimming along a trail of debris left during its multiple trips around the sun. The flame-like … [+2568 chars]

articles.title: Canada's Leylah Fernandez advances to French Open quarter-finals for 1st time - CBC Sports
articles.description: There will be one Canadian in the Roland Garros singles quarter-finals this year, after Leylah Fernandez edged out American Amanda Anisimova 6-4, 3-6, 6-4 in their fourth-round match Sunday. Fellow Canadian Felix Auger-Aliassime came oh, so close to joining h…
